It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble delicate, clustered umbels. The plant's leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, with a smooth, waxy surface that aids in water retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aulomyrcia assumptionis is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
